Skulduggery in Stowmarket: Suffolk's newest crime writers' festival returns for a second year

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 6, 2019

This year's Skulduggery in Stowmarket will take place at the library over four days from 26 - 29 April.

Can you help Suffolk Libraries by sharing your story?

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 6, 2019

Weâ€™re looking for people who love their library and are prepared to tell us about their experience of using our services.

Long Melford residents to benefit from increased opening hours and library refurbishment

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Feb 28, 2019

Long Melford Library will be closed for refurbishment from 25 March - 1 April. It will reopen on Tuesday 2 April with increased opening hours.

Activities at Ipswich libraries

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 8, 2019

Our seven libraries in the Ipswich area - Broomhill, Chantry, Gainsborough, Ipswich, Kesgrave, Rosehill and Stoke - run several regular activities for children of various ages.

Suffolk Libraries mental health project shortlisted for libraries award

Written by James Powell · Published Feb 6, 2019

A pioneering mental health project run in seven Suffolk Libraries has been shortlisted for an EDGE Libraries Conference award.

Life on the Streets photo exhibition at Ipswich County Library

Written by James Powell · Published Feb 5, 2019

Ipswich County Library is currently hosting an exhibition of photographs taken by local people affected by homelessness.

Three Sat Under the Banyan Tree: New Wolsey Theatre to host play inspired by Ipswich County Library

Written by James Powell · Published Feb 5, 2019

Local writer Shamser Sinha's play Three Sat Under the Banyan Tree is coming to Ipswich this weekend as part of a UK tour. He told us how visits to Ipswich County Library with his son inspired him to pen the production, which is based on a collection of Indian fables.

Suffolk Libraries recommends YA titles to mark LGBT History Month 2019

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Feb 1, 2019

This LGBT History Month, we have added lots of great new titles to our Young Adult LGBT recommendation list.

Suffolk Libraries celebrates Harry Potter Book Night

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Feb 1, 2019

Several libraries across Suffolk are hosting Harry Potter events in February to celebrate J. K. Rowling's bestselling books.

Leiston residents invited to have their say about their library

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jan 30, 2019

Leiston Library are asking local people how they use the library.
